item.title: How To Be Confident In Your Neural Network Confidence
item.description: Why deep neural networks confidence are flawed and how to fix it.

item.title: Normalization in Deep Learning
item.description: Overview of the different normalization methods that exist for neural networks.

item.title: Detecting cars from aerial imagery for the NATO Innovation Challenge
item.description: Imagine you’re in a landlocked country, and an infection has spread. The gouvernement has fallen, and rebels are roaming the country. If you’re the armed forces in this scenario, how do you make decisions in this environment? How can you fully understand the situation at hand?

item.title: 3 Small but Powerful Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: Overview of three CNN that have a low computational cost

item.title: Deep Learning Scaling Is Predictable, Empirically
item.description: How much a Deep Learning model would improve if the dataset size increase?

item.title: Fast and Faster Region-based Convolutional Network
item.description: Fast-RCNN is an Object Detection algorithm using Selective Search and CNN.

item.title: Selective Search for Object Recognition
item.description: The Robust Object Proposal used by Fast-RCNN.

item.title: A Few Useful Things To Know About Machine Learning
item.description: This post contains the notes taken from reading of the following paper: A few useful things to know about Machine Learning by Pedro Domingos. This paper does not introduce any novelties in the field of Machine Learning, nor some kinds of benchmarks, but rather offers a overview of the black art of Machine Learning. Domingos covers a wide area of Machine Learning, but each parts are not explored in depth.

item.title: How To Read A Paper
item.description: Summary of a paper about… how to read a paper.
